Posts.Content: kirby wrote: It has only been less than 2 weeks since I was dx with liver and bone mets. I can't seem to absorb it. I feel fine, look fine, doing my regular routine... but, everything has changed. How do you live with Stage IV breast cancer.? I know I need to come to terms with this, but can't even seem to cry. I just feel very hollow inside, and I keep thinking did I fail my body, or did my body fail me? xoxo  Dx 9/1/2009, 3cm, Stage IV, Grade 2, 2/7 nodes, mets, ER+/PR+, HER2- Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Feel like I am having out of body experience kirby IllinoisNancy

Posts.Content: Sep 24, 2009 07:05AM kirby wrote: Thanks for all your replies ~!! I feel better now that I have had a chance to digest the news. I can even get through a conversation without a meltdown. It still seems unreal to me since I am feeling good. I know my treatment plan for now which helps. My liver bx indicated the tumor is very ER/PR ++ so I started on Aromasin and will continue for 6 wks and then repeat scans and blood work. I did go to MDA for consult and they agreed with my oncologist's plan. I will also start Zometa soon. I am praying the Aromasin will work for a good while. I have to say this is a very unusual place to be, but like everything else we have had to deal with, we pick ourselves up and get ready to get these buggers out! We need to continue this fight, for us and for all others that will walk in our path. xoxo
Posts.Title: Feel like I am having out of body experience kirby IllinoisNancy

Posts.Content: kirby wrote: My cobra ends in 2 mos. The company I used to work for does not offer a conversion plan. The only medical insurance I can get is BCBS (PPO) through the Texas Risk Pool . The premiums are through the roof and the deductible and co-insurance high also, but don't have any other options at the moment.Just thankful I can manage the payments now. I will be eligible for medicare in 1.5 yrs. I just started receiving Disability Insurance. I am just wondering if anyone else has this insurance and how good they are about paying claims etc. I am hoping they don't reject any treatment I may need now or in the future. I am hoping that  the new health care bill will be beneficial to all of us, very soon. Thanks! xoxo  Dx 9/1/2009, 3cm, Stage IV, Grade 2, 2/7 nodes, mets, ER+/PR+, HER2- Log in to post a reply

Posts.Content: Jan 21, 2011 08:58PM kirby wrote: I have diffuse liver mets, too. MRI, CT Scan, PT scan didn't pick this up in December. Finally had a liver bx in December. Currently on Faslodex and zometa for bone mets.  Mets first discovered 9/09. Did 8 months of Abraxane/Avastin which got rid of bones mets and decreased liver mets in size and number. I am not sure what my next move will be, don't see my oncologist until middle of February. My liver is still enlarged and all liver tests elevated. I am hoping I don't have to go back on chemo.....Best of luck with your treatment. xoxo
Posts.Title: New Liver Mets 4everhopeful kirby

Posts.Content: Nov 15, 2010 03:46PM kirby wrote: Jenn, I am sorry. I hate this for you, I hate this freaking disease. You never know what is really going on, or what the next step will be. I was on abraxane/avastin for 7 months. Was doing well until my liver was damaged from the chemo. So, I was promptly taken off. Been on Faslodex since, and my markers continue to rise. Had PET scan today, see doctor tomorrow for results. I don't even try to second guess what the results will be, I have been let down so many times..when I thought things were going well. Maybe you should get a scan to confirm. My doctor says sometimes tumor markers rise when cells are dying off, hopefully maybe that is the case. Will be thinking of you. xoxo

Posts.Title: I hate that... BeckyOD Diana63

Posts.Content: Oct 10, 2009 07:21PM kirby wrote: Hi Krystyna, I was recently dx with liver and bone mets a month ago. Not something anyone wants to hear. I had almost made my 5 year mark and also initially dx Stage 2b. I had a liver biopsy after my CT/PET scan to confirm my tumor was breast cancer and still estrogen positive which it is. I had been on arimidex for 4 years and my oncologist said it quit working. I am now taking aromasin and will take it for 6wks and then more scans to see how well it is working (fingers crossed). I also went to MD Anderson in Houston and they felt aromosin was the way to go. I am too new at this, so this is the best information I can share with you, but I am sure more experienced ladies will chime in. As far as age, I am 58, so not too far behind you. I am sorry you had to join us, giving you a big hug and try not to worry too much. Once you get your treatment plan you will feel a little better. xoxo

Posts.Title: Crap Liver Mets ccarter48818 sportsmom

Posts.Content: Sep 5, 2009 12:47AM kirby wrote: Carla, Just wanted to say that I was recently dx with liver and bone mets, and 2 days later my oncologist order a liver biopsy. He said until a biopsy is done that he could not recommend treatment. They have to find out the characteristics of the tumor to see if it was the same from when I was first dx. He said usually doesn't change, but HER ER/PR could, so he has to be sure. I would certainly feel better knowing the whole picture. If your doctor dismisses you I would get a second opinion or change doctors. This stuff is so unpredictable. I am with you- Crap Liver Mets. Take care of yourself. xoxo
Posts.Title: Crap Liver Mets ccarter48818 sportsmom

Posts.Content: Sep 10, 2009 09:54PM kirby wrote: Carla,  My liver biopsy was painless and very fast. Took no longer than 20 minutes and that included prep time in the room. I had some local anesthesia in the area, and then they gave me something to make me relax. I was awake, but felt like I was in a twilight state. It takes a few days or more to get the bx back. I got part of the result yesterday. The tumor is highly ER PR++ and so today I start aromasin. I should get the rest of the report (HER2) next week. I am just happy my oncologist thinks I can benefit from hormonal treatment. I will be thinking about you tomorrow and I hope it does goes off w/o a hitch :)-! xoxo
Posts.Title: Crap Liver Mets ccarter48818 sportsmom

Posts.Content: Apr 8, 2010 09:57PM kirby wrote: Robin, As everyone has said this just plain sucks. I know when I had progression in January I was so dismayed and didn't want to get on hard chemo. But, after reality sunk in, I did and although it has been no fun, it is ok for now. I had #10 Abraxane this week. Last week I had another PET scan and all my liver mets decreased or are no longer there. My bone mets have all disappeared. I don't know all the chemo's you have been on, but Abraxane for me has been good (also on Xeloda, Zometa, Avastin). Worst of course if the hair loss, but for some reason this time around I am coping with that. I wish you the best in what ever decision you make, but take a little time and let everything absorb before you make any final decisions. When I get weak, I just remember that I don't want the Big C to win. Thinking of you. xoxo

Posts.Content: Sep 13, 2010 10:35AM kirby wrote: Hi Lynn, I was on Abraxane, (Avastin and Zometa) from Jan,2010 to Aug, 2010. Been off for 1 month now. Initially my hair clumped up and fell out about 3 wks after 3 treatments. Had some hair, but not much, but some. It did start growing a little for a couple of months. Then about 2 months ago it all fell out and didn't grow. I am still basically bald and have a little growth, not much. Eyebrows, eyelashes, completely gone. I thought I would have more hair growth after 30 days, but I am thinking the longer you have chemo, the longer it takes to grow back? Anyway, I have heard of ladies growing hair while on treatment, so maybe you will be one of the lucky ones, I sure hope so! Just another crappy side effect we have to endure. xoxo

Posts.Content: kirby wrote: I have #21 Abraxane tomorrow. I can't believe I have almost been on this mets journey for almost a year and still fighting and still here. I think physically (except for the lack of any hair) I'm ok. But, emotionally I am sick and tired of this. I know I should be thankful that the chemo has shrunk my liver mets, but realistically, I am not comfortable knowing to survive I will probably have to be on chemo. I don't know, my oncolgist is planning for me to have a total of 27 Abraxanes, which puts me ending this in September. But, I can't help but wonder, then What???  How do all you wonderful women live on the edge without falling off?? :)- xoxo Dx 9/1/2009, 3cm, Stage IV, Grade 2, 2/7 nodes, mets, ER+/PR+, HER2- Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Getting ready for tomorrow kirby ChocolateLover

Posts.Content: Jul 12, 2010 06:44PM kirby wrote: Hi Ladies, thanks for all your replies. I made it through treatment today with out any problems. I still don't have a port, but so far my veins have been ok. I think what I am saying and thinking to myself is that I need to have a chemo break come this September. I feel tired, beat up, in a funk, and can't think of anything I want to be doing while on chemo.  I know I should embrace this time. I know I should be happy the chemo is working. But, I on the other hand know with some certainty that this is my new way of living, It is just hard to find any joy right now. I don't want to give up to this freaking disease, but I don't want my QOL to be anymore lessened than it is now. We all walk such a fine line here. I do know that my mother in law died 25 years ago of breast cancer, and I can only think that yes we have made improvements in treatment, we are still loosing too many to this thing called cancer, Thanks for listening and understanding, and I do hope I will have an option of going back on an AI in September. And yes, chocolate is a given :)- Love, xoxo

Posts.Content: Jul 13, 2010 03:04PM kirby wrote: There must be something in the air. I am having similiar feelings as you. It's like we can never get away from this. Everywhere I turn, I see cancer. It's like a radio, some days you hear it as background music, but other days it is so loud and you can't turn down the volumn. I have only been on this mets journey for 10 months, but I am so tired of it. Just had Abraxane #21 yesterday and onc says we are going for 27. Some days I wonder, what's the point? It is probably going to get me in the end anyway. I know, I know I need to remain positive, but some days we have to allow ourselves to mourn what our life used to be. But, I know we are all strong and we will do what we have to do to get through this. It isn't fun, it isn't pretty, but I suppose for now that is all we have- Hope. I have to count my blessings at the end of the day because I know things could be much worse, with or without the cancer crap. Hope you can find away this week to feel better. Just know you are not alone in the journey. xoxo

Posts.Title: lost it today jleigh dianaleo

Posts.Content: Aug 4, 2010 11:47PM - edited Aug 4, 2010 11:48PM by kirby Well this time around I got 3 wigs, 2 that are just alike because I wear them more often. They are synthetic, but so much better than the wigs I had 5 years ago. I remember they itched and they just didn't look as good. I find this time around since I have a little fuzz not much itching with the wig on and nobody can tell it is a wig. I decided this time I would get my wigs professional washed every few weeks and it has made a tremendous difference in the way they look and also makes me feel better! I think I am spending more on my wigs than I ever did on my real hair. . Maybe you can find one you like and start wearing that one and then somehow transition into the expensive wig. I am with you though. I told my husband that if and when it is my time to go I better have some freaking hair on my head. Why or why can't most chemos not have the side effect of hair loss. For me I think I would feel so much better if I could hold on to my hair. Hope tomorrow the sun comes out and it is a better day for you~the crap we have to put up with xoxo PS. I wear a liner under the wig and it has helped with the itch :}-
Posts.Title: Got My Wig Ready Today - RANT! jeanne46 Jellydonut

Posts.Title: Success Stories for Xeloda and Avistan kirby Jollymom

Posts.Content: Aug 5, 2010 07:23PM kirby wrote: Had first Abraxane Jan. 11, and by Feb 1st hair pretty much gone. I had cut it short and was planning to cut it shorter the week it left, but it was sneaky and beat me to it. I went into the shower and was going to wash hair, but as soon as the water hit it, it all clumped up in a tight ball on top of head. It was terrible. My sister drove in from out of town to cut it off which took about 20 minutes, it was surreal. So the moral to my story, is be prepared and cut it very short now. In the meantime my hair grows and falls out and my eyebrows, lashes are gone, gone, gone. Thank God for make up. Hope you will have a better hair experience... this is such a crappy side effect. xoxo

Posts.Content: Sep 3, 2009 06:43PM kirby wrote: You ladies are so amazing. I read and re-read your responses and feel better and know I will be joining you often through out my new journey. I had my liver bx today. It was a piece of cake ( well for me, I don't know about the doctor:)-) Seriously, no pain and went smoothly. Sometimes I think oh my, this all won't be too hard to tolerate and then a minute later tears are streaming down my face. It will be a long holiday weekend for me. I will let you know what the bx results are. In the meantime I am scheduling a consult at M D Anderson. Much Love, xoxo
Posts.Title: Am I Stage IV now? kirby happytobealive
